main event: Multiple witnesses observed a spherical, luminous object moving from north to south in the Blackstone and Gordonsville, Virginia area on June 15, 1952.
interesting points: The object was observed by pilots of two different aircraft - a Marine R4D flying at 3,000 feet and 170 mph, and a USAF T-33 jet flying at 13,200 feet and 450 mph.
Ground observers included a CAA operator in Blackstone, Virginia who estimated the object's altitude to be 25,000-30,000 feet.
Other witnesses included a CAA operator in Greenville, Virginia and a woman in Unionville, Virginia.
The weather at the time included scattered thunderstorms and winds aloft of 45 knots from 300 degrees at 20,000 feet.
Nearby aircraft activities included a Marine aircraft over Blackstone and an Air Force jet over Greenville.
